The dog isn't at risk of barking in the night.
The fowl stop the monthly disturbance.
The outer door isn't closed.
They rest high and don't worry.
Also...
Their doors are always closed.
The roads are cut off from collecting leftovers.
There's no plowman who unpacks his pole on Long Shang.
They despise the red-headed man who handled the troops at Daoist Lake.
The sound of the watch sinks at night.
People enjoy the spring dais.
I wish...
"Where his grace is returned, it's like the moon appearing in a clear lake.
When he vows for the fulfillment of that vow, it's like a sound transmitted through an empty valley.
The myriad spirits apprehend the frame.
The seal of the Three Treasures illuminates it.
Also...
I've been given the gift of the aggregates.
I dare to repent of my first promise.
I would like to express my respects for the sincerity of this day.
I would like to take the preceding days as a compliment.
Also...
On the desk of the six officials.
It's in the book of the three realms.
"He wants to cancel the name that was first approved.
He asks for an explanation of the words that were eventually filled in.
Pre-cultivation

source_sentence: 幸得人身在識脩身之理。
translation: "Fortunately, I've attained personal consciousness and the principle of body cultivation.

source_sentence: 叨居塵世當明出世之因。
translation: Those who have been harbored by living in the defiled world should understand the causes of their worldly escape.
If he didn't adorn himself in previous lives.
What will be the seeds of later retribution?'
He cultivates the results of his efforts in advance.
He'll greatly disseminate Jinliang.
Take advantage of this good opportunity to do so.
He'll surely attain further rewards in the future.
Also...

source_sentence: 寒必索裘豈待既寒之後。
translation: They must ask for a coat when it's cold, not after it's cold.

source_sentence: 渴當掘井必須未渴之前。
translation: He must dig a well when he's thirsty, but not before he's thirsty.
You must do good deeds in this life.
Perhaps he'll bring down goodness in another life.
I always wish...
The wise emperor's noble life span is equal in heaven.
The civil and military officials are increasingly distinguished by their official qualifications.
He navigated ten thousand countries by ladder.
He carries a crown over a hundred barbarians.
He blended the commonplace with the benevolent gods.
He includes the eight wildernesses in his domain of longevity.
At the time, they adjust the jade candles.
The seasons will coincide with the golden harvest.
There's no transgression of the yang in winter and no quelling of the yin in summer.
There's no quelling of the yin in summer.
The wind doesn't beat its stripes, and the rain doesn't break the clumps.
Rain doesn't break the clumps.
All kinds of happiness arise in the ruling state.
The four peoples each have a fulfilling career.
Those who practice Confucianism will have their names inscribed at the Yan Tower.
Those who practice the arts await the imperial decree at the Golden Gate.

source_sentence: 出塗藏市富金刀泉布之饒。
translation: Those who go out to the market to store gold, are rich in swords and springs, and are fecund in cloth.

source_sentence: 鑿井耕田有稼穡倉箱之積。
translation: Those who dig wells and till the fields have accumulated storehouses for crops.
Ten times as many silkworms and mulberry plants are grown.
Their profits and emoluments are both complete.
It's called longevity, wealth, and well-being.
It will bring prosperity, prosperity, prosperity, prosperity, and prosperity for the elderly.
A household receives a thousand fortunes and a hundred blessings.
The family experiences none of the nine vexations and three calamities.
People are delighted when they reach spring.
The dogs don't hear them barking in the night.
Beacons are destroyed in distant jams.
The grass bows and wafers.
Feathers, scales, and armor all grow and proliferate.
Their plants move, fly, and proliferate.
Upward, they reach the top of existence.
Below that, they reach the limitless.
All sentient beings are subject to the same level of attainment.
They'll all reach the other shore together.

source_sentence: 高峰龍泉院因師編集賢語錄卷之十
translation: Record of Good Words, Vol. 10, compiled by the master of the Longquan Institute at Kōbō
